content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
No structures have been successfully placed on the map. Repeated attempts to locate or place an Automation Lab at (0.5, 2.5) did not yield a persistent Lab structure, and although furnace entities (an alternative furnace at Position(5.0, 5.0) and a copper furnace at Position(-27.0, -60.0)) were referenced during smelting operations, none were newly constructed by the agent. The final map state remains empty.

ERROR TIPS
• API Usage Errors
  – Avoid passing unsupported keyword arguments (e.g., “radius”) or extra positional parameters when calling functions like get_entities. Always verify the function’s signature and use only the accepted parameters.
  
• Handling Null Results
  – Check that API calls or entity retrievals return a valid, non-None value before iterating over the result. Use fallbacks (such as an empty list) to prevent errors like “‘NoneType’ object is not iterable.”
  
• Lab Placement and Crafting Issues
  – Confirm that the Lab component exists in the inventory before attempting placement to prevent placement failures.
  – Ensure all required sub-ingredients (for example, iron-gear-wheels, electronic circuits, and copper cables) are available in sufficient quantities before crafting a Lab.
  
• Resource Chain Management
  – Monitor and address shortages in key resources (such as iron plates and copper plates) early in the production chain. Employ proper smelting or crafting processes to secure intermediate items needed for subsequent steps in Lab production.
